H0.text: The method used to obtain nutrients and energy is the same life function for an amoeba as for other freshwater protists.

H1.text: The process used to constantly remove excess water is the same life function for an amoeba as for other freshwater protists.

H2.text: The method used to detect changes in their environment is the life function that is the same for an amoeba as for other freshwater protists.

H3.text: The process used to remove waste products from their cytoplasm is the same life function for an amoeba as it is for other freshwater protists.

A4.text: Research on the CV can therefore help us understand how osmoregulation works in all species.

A5.text: The CV does not exist in higher organisms, but some of its unique characteristics are used by them in their osmoregulatory mechanisms.
